org.csstudio.platform.internal.simpledal
Class AbstractConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.internal.simpledal.AbstractConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
IControlSystemItem, IProcessVariable, IProcessVariableAdressProvider, IConnector, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DalConnector, LocalConnector
public abstract class AbstractConnector
extends Object
implements IConnector, IProcessVariableAdressProvider, IProcessVariable

Base class for connectors. A connector encapsulates all program logic that is needed to use a certain application layer that accesses process variables. A connector can be used for one-time-action, e.g. getting or setting a process variable´s value as well for permanent-action which means to register listeners for updates of process variables values. For convenience the IProcessVariableValueListeners are only weakly referenced. The connector tracks for IProcessVariableValueListeners that have been garbage collected and removes those references from its internal list. This way IProcessVariableValueListeners don´t have to be removed from the connector explicitly.

Author:
Sven Wende, Xihui Chen

addProcessVariableValueListener

public final void addProcessVariableValueListener(String characteristicId,
                                                  IProcessVariableValueListener listener)
Adds a value listener. When a characteristic is provided, the specified listener is only informed of changes in that characteristic.

Parameters:
listener - a value listener (has to be !=null)
characteristicId - the id of a characteristic (can be null)

sendInitialValuesForNewListener

protected void sendInitialValuesForNewListener(String characteristicId,
                                               IProcessVariableValueListener listener)

removeProcessVariableValueListener

public final boolean removeProcessVariableValueListener(IProcessVariableValueListener listener)
Removes the specified value listener. This is optional - a connector does reference its listeners weak by design. This way connectors that are no longer referenced outside of the connector will get garbage collected anyway.

Parameters:
listener - the value listener to be removed from the connector

isDisposable

public final boolean isDisposable()
Determines, whether this connector can get disposed. This is, when no value listeners for the connector live in the JVM anymore.

Specified by:
isDisposable in interface IConnector
Returns:
true, if this connector can be disposed, false otherwise
